messages.content: I didn't expect to be writing to you again so soon! But I think Theresa May was right to call a general election for 8th June. To begin Brexit negotiations in the EU, the country needs strong and stable leadership. When she goes into bat for Britain, she deserves the strongest possible mandate. In the last year I have had two main priorities: to ensure that we make leaving the EU feel fair and respected, and to get United Lincolnshire Hospitals Trust to reopen Grantham A&E at nights. That is why I left hospital in a wheelchair to vote for Article 50. And in March organised a meeting with the Prime Minister to discuss the unacceptable situation at Grantham Hospital.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Support local health services and reopen Grantham A&E at nights.
Make the economy even stronger by supporting measures that have cut unemployment to its lowest level for decades.
Support Theresa May in getting the best deal for Britain as we leave the European Union.

issues.brexitEurope: Theresa May was right to call a general election for 8th June. To begin Brexit negotiations in the EU, the country needs strong and stable leadership. When she goes into bat for Britain, she deserves the strongest possible mandate.
issues.economy: cut unemployment to its lowest level for decades
issues.health: organised a meeting with the Prime Minister to discuss the unacceptable situation at Grantham Hospital
issues.socialWelfare: I promise to support Theresa May in getting the best deal for Britain as we leave the European Union and have proved in my past to support local health services and to support our superb local schools.

community.content: to get United Lincolnshire Hospitals Trust to reopen Grantham A&E at nights.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have just finished my treatment for non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. I have now completed chemotherapy and am doing well. The cancer has been eradicated, but I am afraid the doctors won't let do much physical campaigning before 8th June so please email me on nick@nickboles.co.uk if you have any questions or concerns.

That is why I left hospital in a wheelchair to vote for Article 50. And in March organised a meeting with the Prime Minister to discuss the unacceptable situation at Grantham Hospital.

contactInformation.address: Grantham & Stamford Conservatives, 62 North Street, Bourne, PE10 9AJ
